dtliExcerpt: Glenn Close's return to the role of Norma Desmond in Sunset Boulevard is a master class in musical-theater acting, but the production around her feels oddly diminished.
bwwExcerpt: But Sunset Boulevard, which opened tonight in a train wreck of a revival starring a woeful Glenn Close, also comes with a poison pill for would-be adapters. Its daring mix of film noir and Hollywood satire requires the utmost finesse to carry off, lest it turn into camp, a mere coffin of curiosities. (We are in fact introduced to Norma as she kisses the corpse of her pet chimp.) That it doesn't go rancid - that the film remains beautiful despite its overbite - is attributable to Wilder's worldli
